meaningMnemonic: What do you <radical>say</radical> to a <radical>guard</radical>? Your <kanji>theory</kanji> about how the thing he's guarding isn't even real. Yeah, you have this whole thing figured out. You have for a while. At this point, it's only fair that you tell your theory to the guard who's wasting his time.
readingMnemonic: The guard listens to your <kanji>theory</kanji> but then he says his OWN! He thinks there are two <reading>sets</reading> (せつ) of guarded items, and he's only guarding one. According to his theory, either one could be real! His theory is more plausible, don't you think?
